sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词都有"盖子，遮盖物"之意。
means: cover ： 泛指所有的遮盖物。包括盖子或书籍、杂志的封面等。
lid ： 通常指可以揭开的如箱盖、坛盖、壶盖等盖子。

sentence.Network_en: As we drew near, I saw that the boot lid was up.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们靠近时,我看见汽车行李箱的盖子翘了起来.

sentence.Network_en: The lid, turned upside down, served as a coffee table.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个盖子被翻过来当作咖啡桌。

sentence.Network_en: The soldiers' presence seemed to keep a lid on the violence.
sentence.Network_cn: 士兵的存在似乎抑制住了暴力活动。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)keep (an emotion or process) from going out of control

lj.lj_ly: she was no longer able to keep the lid on her simmering anger.
lj.lj_ls: 她再也无法克制住满腔的怒气了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)put a stop to or be the culmination of

lj.lj_ly: it's time to put the lid on all the talk.
lj.lj_ls: 到了该结束所有这些谈话的时候了。

phrase.cizu_name: take (或lift) the lid off (或lift the lid on)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hlid, of Germanic origin, from a base meaning 'cover'; related to Dutch lid

entry.def: A lid is the top of a box or other container which can be removed or raised when you want to open the container.
Your lids are the pieces of skin which cover your eyes when you close them.

example.ex: A dull pain began to throb behind his lids.
example.tran: 他的眼皮后面开始隐隐作痛地抽动。

entry.def: If you say that someone is keeping the lid on an activity or a piece of information, you mean that they are restricting the activity or are keeping the information secret.

example.ex: The soldiers' presence seemed to keep a lid on the violence...
example.tran: 士兵的存在似乎抑制住了暴力活动。

example.ex: Their finance ministry is still trying to put a lid on the long-simmering securities scandal.
example.tran: 他们的财政部仍在试图遮掩一触即发的证券丑闻。

entry.def: If you say that you want to keep a lid on the cost of doing something, you mean that you want to prevent it costing you more than you feel is reasonable.

example.ex: If our industry is to remain competitive it must mean keeping a lid on prices.
example.tran: 我们的行业要想保持竞争力，就必须对价格加以控制。

means.word_mean: 1. either of two folds of skin that can be moved to cover or open the eye;

sentences.sentence: "his lids would stay open no longer"

means.word_mean: 2. a movable top or cover (hinged or separate) for closing the opening of a container
3. headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim

example.en: I just knew you'd blow your lid.
example.zh: 我就知道你会发脾气的。

sentences.en: He lifted the lid of the box and looked inside.
Put the lid on the box.
The new law will put a lid on government spending
sentences.cn: 新法律将限制政府开支。

sentences.en: They told us to keep a lid on the report until the campaign was over.
sentences.cn: 他们告诉我们竞选结束之前遮盖住那份报告。

jushi.english: He lifted the lid of the box and looked inside.

jushi.chinese: 那个盖子很容易地掉了下来。
